message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper explores the relationship between two ideas in network information theory, namely edge removal and strong converses. Network information theory is a subfield of information theory that deals with the fundamental limits of communication networks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper specifically focuses on the capacity region and probability of error, which are concepts related to network coding and communication. Hence, cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the blowing-up lemma, which is a technique used in computational geometry and topology, making cs.SI (Symbolic Computation and Algebraic Manipulation) another possible sub-category. The paper uses mathematical proofs and techniques, indicating that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also possible sub-categories.
